response.answer: The prior policy inception date is located on the Underwriting screen under the Prior Policies tab.
When required, the Driver Exclusion form can be found on the Documents screen in PolicyCenter. Click the View button to the left of the document to view and print.
There is only one Water Backup coverage now. Refer to the One Product Reference Guide for your state for more information.

Unbound submissions/quotes can be withdrawn in PolicyCenter. Note, once a submission is withdrawn, it cannot be reopened.rr Refer to the Withdraw a Submission (Quote) job aid for steps to withdraw an unbound submission or quote.
descarray: Job Aid - Withdraw Submission

response.answer: The Valuables Plus (Inland Marine) product provides brad coverage for customers that require additional protection beyond the base homeowner policy for personal property types, such as jewelry, furs, etc. Valuables Plus endorsements are available on Homeowner, Tenant, and Condo policies. For more information about Valuables Plus (Inland Marine), including Valuables Plus (Inland Marine) Transfers, refer to the One Product Reference Guide for your state.
You may write the dwelling fire in your current system

Square Footage information is pulled from MSB. If this is a new quote, go to the Dwelling Construction screen, and click the Launch MSB button. Enter and save information in MSB, then return to PolicyCenter. Click the Retrieve from MSB button. If you have already pulled from MSB and need to update, copy the MSB Estimate # from the Coverages screen, and return to the Dwelling Construction screen. Paste the estimate # in the Find existing using estimate number field. Click the Launch MSB button, update the information, save, and click the Retrieve from MSB button.

response.answer: Agents do not have the ability to reinstate policies. Please contact your service center.

A change can not be deleted or reversed; however, you can create a second change and counterbalance the first change. For example, if a driver was removed in the first change, add the driver back in the second change.
It is not possible to have three named insureds on a policy. You can add one (1) secondary named insured, and then the third person as an Additional Named insured.
descarray: Job Aid - Add or Delete Secondary Named Insured - Auto/Property

response.answer: To print/reprint documents, click the Documents link in the left navigation pane. On the Online Documents tab, click the View button for the appropriate document, then print the document as normal. From the Print Customer Documents tab, click the View/Print button for the appropriate document, then print as normal. From the Resend Print tab,  select the check box to the left of the appropriate document(s) and click the Resend button. Note: using this feature mails a copy of the document directly to the customer.

response.answer: The Privacy Statement is added on the Online Documents tab of the Documents screen. Click the Add button and select **Privacy Statement** from the list.

response.answer: To edit policy renewals  1. Only unbound renewals can be edited. If the renewal has been bound, a policy change is required.  2. To edit an unbound renewal, go to the Summary screen of the policy.  3. From Work Orders in Progress section, select the Renewal Work Order number.  4. Click the Edit button at the top of the screen area, read the pop-up message and click the OK button, and on the Policy Info screen, click the Coverages link in the left navigation pane. 5. Make all edits, click Quote, click the Policy Review link in the left navigation pane, review changes, and click the Renew button. Click OK on the pop-up screen.
descarray: Policy Renewal Process (Team Tab)

response.answer: The Create Policy button is used when you need to add an AgentCenter policy, such as a Nationwide affiliated company (Allied, or Harleysville), a Nationwide-Hagerty, a Powersports, or a Private Client underlier to the submission.

response.answer: To change a mortgagee, on the Policy Info screen, click the Mortgagee/Additional Interest link. Or, you can select the existing mortgagee and click on Remove to delete it.

response.answer: Social security numbers are not required, but if you are receiving an error, please check the format of your entry to make sure that it's correct.
It's possible that your state is not yet in PolicyCenter. Please confirm that PolicyCenter is available in your state.

A premium credit for homes meeting IBHS Fortified Home standard. The home must be inspected by a Fortified Evaluator and then certified by the IBHS who determine the designation level and issue a certificate. Certificates are valid for 5 years. The insured must provide a copy of the designation certificate. Not available to policies that excluded Wind Hail coverage and is mutually exclusive with the Wind Mitigation rating variable and Better Roof Replacement.

response.answer: Please contact your underwriter regarding any auto violations, such as speeding.
You can review the gray info bar on the policy. The current status will be listed there.
All claims returned from the CLUE report are listed under the primary named insured on the Driver's Screen. It is not necessary to move the claim to another driver.
Brand New Belongings is added on the Coverages screen under the Section 1 Coverages.

Ensure the effective date of your quote is past the PolicyCenter new business effective date for your state. If you are looking to for a quote prior to the PolicyCenter new business effective date for your state, return to your legacy system to complete your quote.
Unfortunately, at this time, defaults can only be set for auto submissions.
To submit payment(s) on bound policies, Exclusive Agents should use BAM directly, and Independent Agents should use AgentCenter.
To manage billing, Exclusive Agents should use BAM directly, and Independent Agents should use AgentCenter.
Accounts cannot be deleted.
At this time, PolicyCenter does not support email notifications for Activities; however, it is on the list for a future enhancement.

Defensive Driver, and other Driver Training, classes are acknowledged on the Drivers screen on the Auto policy. Select the Driver Training option under the Discounts section. Note: selection of this discount will require the policyholder to provide documentation of proof of completion

response.answer: SR22s cannot be printed. They are only mailed to the insured and to the DMV.
Please contact ITSD regarding any system outage notices: +1 888 667 3866.
Up to four (4) vehicles can be added to each Auto policy. If needed, a "5th" vehicle policy can be created with up to four (4) additional vehicles.
Campers must be insured on a Recreational Vehicle policy, which are still handled on your legacy system.
Territory should be returned from the GIS system. What has returned from GIS can be viewed on the Dwelling screen in the Geographic Data section.

To start a policy change, navigate to the in force policy. Click the **Actions** button in the left navigation pane. Select **Change Policy** from the drop-down menu. Complete the change, quote, and issue the policy.

To accomplish this, you will need to add all of the policies to an existing Billing account. Refer to page 5 of the Create a Billing Account for a New Submission  job aid for the process to add a policy to an existing billing account.

A cancellation can only be rescinded if the cancellation date is in the future. If a policy was cancelled effective immediately, please contact the PLSC at +1 877 669 6877 for help reinstating the policy.

Policy change cannot be deleted once bound. You will need to make a second change to counterbalance the changes made previously. If you need assistance with this process, please call PLSC at +1 877 669 6877.

The Memorandum of Insurance is found on the Online Documents tab, on the Documents screen and is updated in real time.  In some cases you may need to click the **Add** button and select the memorandum of Insurance from that list.

The pre-selected affinity affiliation is typically the policyholders best benefit, however, you can review other options. Refer to the **Add Affinity Relationship** job aid for step-by-step instructions.

response.answer: If the agent selected the Easy Pay Discount in the Policy Info tab then the only option in the payment screen is EFT.  The "Easy Pay" Discount will need to be removed in the Policy Info tab for the Payment tab to offer additional payment options.

To start any quote, first pull up the client in order to access the Account Summary screen. Click the arrow to the right of the Actions field, and then select "New Submission" from the drop-down menu.  What type of quote would you like to start?

Farm Bureau voting members will automatically be identified during the quoting process and cannot be added or removed manually. The One Product reference guides can provide more information about your state's Farm Bureau discount.

To begin a new quote on the same member account, return to the Account for the member. (Click the Account # link in the info bar, at the top of the policy.) Once on the Account File Summary screen, click the Actions button at the top of the left navigation pane. Select "New Submission" from the list. Select the appropriate product and proceed through the quote.

Information needs to match what is in MSB. If you have already pulled from MSB and need to update, copy the MSB Estimate # from the Coverages screen, and return to the Dwelling Construction screen. Paste the estimate # in the Find existing using estimate number field. Click the Launch MSB button, update the information, save, and click the Retrieve from MSB button.

response.answer: Start a change on the Property policy. Navigate to the Coverages screen, deselect the Additional Residence Rented to Others coverage listed in the Section II Coverages section. If you have more than one property listed in this section, and only want to remove one property, select the check box next to the property to be removed, and click the Remove button.
You may replace the policy mailing address with your agency address.

To begin a new quote on the same member account, return to the Account for the member. (Click the Account # link in the info bar, at the top of the policy.) Once on the Account File Summary screen, click the Actions button at the top of the left navigation pane. Select "New Submission" from the list. Select the appropriate product and proceed through the quote.

response.answer: Roadside Assistance is added on Coverages screen. For more information about what is covered under Roadside Assistance, please reference your state's One Product guide.
Water backup coverage is added on the Coverages screen under the Section 1 Coverages.

There are several required fields on the Household Members screen that must be answered before you can move forward (or back) in the system. Double check to make sure all required questions are answered, including the "Any liability losses greater than $50,000 in the last three years" question that must be answered for each household member.
An Umbrella policy cannot be bound until all underlying policies are also bound. Return to the auto policy and bind/issue, then return to the umbrella policy to bind.
